label: 催馬楽
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: The saibara, like the imayō (modern song") and rōei, was a major Heian vocal genre.  The lyrics, of which over sixty are extant, were for the most part Nara-period folk songs, set to Chinese music early in the Heian period (p. 422). [今様、朗詠]"
